item.title: Karishma Furtado, Alexis Duncan, Jen Kocher, Pranav Nandan

item.description: I am an MPH candidate in Epidemiology and Biostatistics at Washington University in St. Louis with a background in Neuroscience and Genetics. I have experience in both psychiatric and chronic disease epidemiology, with particular emphases on eating disorders, diabetes, and comorbidity. I'm currently interested in the application of machine learning and big data to epidemiologic problems, as well as the development of new causal inference methods for big data. When I'm not in the lab or fiddling around in R, you can find me playing Settlers of Catan, running, cycling, or perfecting the art of latte making. Thanks for stopping by!
